FuncDef:
The pcp server command specifies a PCP server address in a specific NAT instance.
The undo pcp server command deletes the PCP server address in a specific NAT instance.
By default, no PCP server address is specified for a NAT instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address mask of a PCP server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of a PCP server IPv4 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

Specifies the IPv4 address of a PCP server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CGN device (PCP server) must be assigned an IP address so that a CPE (PCP client) can send a request to establish a PCP connection to the CGN device.
Precautions
The pcp server command is mutually exclusive with interface addresses, tunnel addresses, PCP addresses in the other instances, the local global addresses of servers in a local instance, addresses in an address pool of a local instance, global addresses of servers in the other instances, addresses used in a DS-Lite instance, static-algorithm global addresses, addresses in NAT64 address pools and global address pools, interface addresses in the same network segment, addresses in address pools configured on a DHCP server and a BRAS, and NAT IP addresses in a dual-device scenario.
A single PCP server IPv4 address can be specified in each NAT instance, and the specified address cannot be used as a physical interface address, a loopback interface address, or an address in an address pool.
